raytracer.data.math
Class CommonOps

java.lang.Object
  raytracer.data.math.CommonOps

public abstract class CommonOps
extends java.lang.Object

And abstract class containing some static common vector and matrix operations.

Author:
Karsten Daemen

Method Detail

subtract

public static void subtract(raytracer.data.math.Matrix A,
                            raytracer.data.math.Matrix B,
                            raytracer.data.math.Matrix C)

Subtracts the matrix B from A and stores the result in matrix C, this may be A or B.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the dimensions of A, B and C or not the same.

unCheckedSubtract

public static void unCheckedSubtract(raytracer.data.math.Matrix A,
                                     raytracer.data.math.Matrix B,
                                     raytracer.data.math.Matrix C)

Subtracts the matrix B from A and stores the result in matrix C, this may be A or B. Remark that it's the users responsibility to make sure that each matrix has the same dimensions.

unCheckedAdd

public static void unCheckedAdd(raytracer.data.math.Matrix A,
                                raytracer.data.math.Matrix B,
                                raytracer.data.math.Matrix C)

Adds the matrix B to A and stores the result in matrix C, this may be A or B. Remark that it's the users responsibility to make sure that each matrix has the same dimensions.

mult

public static void mult(raytracer.data.math.Matrix A,
                        raytracer.data.math.Matrix B,
                        raytracer.data.math.Matrix C)

multiplies the matrix A with B and stores the result in matrix C, the inner data arrays of C may NOT be the same as these in A or B (So be careful when multiplying matrixes from methods like Vector.wrapAround() or Matrix.wrapAround()).

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the dimensions of A, B and C are illegal for a matrix multiplication.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the inner data arrays of A and C or B and C are the same.

unCheckedMult

public static void unCheckedMult(raytracer.data.math.Matrix A,
                                 raytracer.data.math.Matrix B,
                                 raytracer.data.math.Matrix C)

multiplies the matrix A with B and stores the result in matrix C, the inner data arrays of C may NOT be the same as these in A or B (So be careful when multiplying matrixes from methods like Vector.wrapAround() or Matrix.wrapAround()). Remark that it's the users responsibility to make sure of this.

mult

public static void mult(raytracer.data.math.Matrix A,
                        raytracer.data.math.Vector B,
                        raytracer.data.math.Vector C)

Multiplies the matrix A with the vector B and stores the result in vector C.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the dimensions of A, B and C are illegal for a matrix-vector multiplication.

unCheckedMult

public static void unCheckedMult(raytracer.data.math.Matrix A,
                                 raytracer.data.math.Vector B,
                                 raytracer.data.math.Vector C)

Multiplies the matrix A with the vector B and stores the result in vector C. It's the user responsibility to make sure that each vector has the same dimensions.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When vectors A and B have different dimensions.
